Description: Fragment of lid of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis. Inside glazed (fired red) with four reserved bands preserved. Outside; around lost knob, rays; dot band between dilute band and lines; animal frieze; preserved, neck, left upper foreleg, body, and haunch, and the end of tail(?) of a lion striding to left; rosette in the field above; added red on the lion's mane and haunch.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 84 no. 279 pl. 63)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2089)
